Class MusicPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.MusicPlayer

  • public class MusicPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    The music player used in the Compounded Game.
    Version:
    5.0 8/8/2014
    Author:
    George Lim Time spent: 22 hours

    • Constructor Detail

      • MusicPlayer

        public MusicPlayer()
        Constructor adds all the songs in the music folder to the tracks ArrayList. The try catch is used to catch multiple exceptions that could happen with using LineListener. The first for loop iterates through all of the files in importedSongs.

        LineListener inner class documentation: update () is used change the currently playing song if the song has ended.

        Parameters:
        importedSongs - File array: A list of songs in the music folder.
        listener - LineListener reference: The LineListener that is added to all of the songs, changing the song when needed.
        e - Exception reference: Contains info about an exception, if it is thrown.
        event - LineEvent reference in inner class: Contains info about the line event.
        i - Loop integer variable: used to iterate through the for-loop to import all songs from folder.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if the line is unavailable.
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - if the audio file is unsupported.
        IOException - if an error occurs while reading to the file.

      • MusicPlayer

        public MusicPlayer(java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new MusicPlayer with the specified fileName.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to be played by this music player.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Begins playing the file specified by fileName. The first if statement exits the method if the music is already playing. The try-catch is used to catch a LineUnavailableException, UnsupportedAudioFileException, and IOException.
        Parameters:
        e - Exception reference: Contains info about an exception, if thrown.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - - if the line is unavailable.
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - - if the audio file is not supported.
        IOException - - if an error occurs while reading to the file.

      • sync

        public void sync()
        Synchronizes music volume.

      • adjustVolume

        public void adjustVolume()
        Adjusts the volume to the specified number of decibels.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops playing the music that is specified by currentlyPlaying. The first if statement checks that currentlyPlaying does not have a null reference. The second if statement checks that tracks does not have a null reference.
